importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date the article was updated, indicating the current status of the investigation into Kada Scott's disappearance.
The date Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace, marking the beginning of the active investigation into her disappearance.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The two-week period following Kada Scott’s disappearance, during which authorities discovered human remains and made arrests, indicating the urgency and timeline of the investigation.

keyTakeAways: Human remains of an unidentified female were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a heavily wooded area.
The remains are being evaluated by the medical examiner to determine if they belong to Kada Scott, a 23-year-old Philadelphia woman who went missing on October 4, 2025.
Keon King, 21, was arrested and charged with Scott’s kidnapping, as well as a prior kidnapping case involving a domestic assault and unlawful detention.
Police believe King was in contact with Scott before her disappearance and that he is the last known person to have communicated with her.
A tip from the public led investigators to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King, which was later found in an apartment complex parking lot.
Phone tracking and digital evidence (including video and social media) indicate Scott had contact with King shortly after leaving work.
King is currently facing two kidnapping charges, one for Scott and one for a prior case from earlier in the year, with both cases under preliminary hearing status.
The prior case was dropped in May due to a witness not appearing in court, but has been refiled.
Authorities are investigating whether other individuals were involved in the kidnapping, though all current leads point to King.
The city of Philadelphia, including Mayor Cherelle Parker, has publicly expressed support for Scott’s family and called for public assistance in solving the case.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman from Philadelphia who went missing on October 4, 2025.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the central figure in the disappearance case, and the discovery of human remains suggests her possible death and the investigation's focus on identifying her remains.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man arrested and charged with the kidnapping of Kada Scott and a prior kidnapping case involving domestic violence.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect in Scott’s disappearance and has been linked through phone tracking and digital evidence as the last known contact with her.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Police Department
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The local law enforcement agency leading the investigation into Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The department is actively investigating the case and has coordinated with federal agencies, including the FBI, to pursue leads and identify suspects.

namedEntities.name: FBI Violent Crime Task Force
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A federal law enforcement unit assisting the Philadelphia Police in the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The FBI’s involvement adds a higher level of investigation authority and resources to the case, indicating its severity and national interest.

namedEntities.name: John Stanford
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: First Deputy Commissioner of the Philadelphia Police Department, who addressed the public regarding the discovery of remains and investigation status.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provided official updates on the discovery of the remains and the ongoing investigation, lending credibility and leadership to the case.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Assistant District Attorney leading the prosecution of Keon King’s charges.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided legal context for the charges, explained the significance of King’s last contact with Scott, and confirmed the refiled charges from a prior case.

namedEntities.name: Frank Vanore
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Police Deputy Commissioner who discussed patterns of behavior and public outreach efforts.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He emphasized the suspected pattern of behavior by King and the importance of public tips in solving the case.

namedEntities.name: Cherelle Parker
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Mayor of Philadelphia, who publicly supported Scott’s family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her statement reflects city-level support for the family and underscores the emotional and social impact of the case on the community.

namedEntities.name: Kim Matthews
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Mother of Kada Scott, who expressed fear for her daughter’s safety.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her personal testimony illustrates the family’s anguish and the emotional stakes of the investigation.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Father of Kada Scott, who urged the public to provide information.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He emphasized the importance of small tips in helping solve the case, showing public engagement as a key part of the investigation.

namedEntities.name: Gold 1999 Toyota Camry
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A vehicle linked to Keon King and believed to be associated with Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its discovery via a public tip highlights how public input can lead to critical evidence in missing persons cases.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, after being last seen at her workplace. Two weeks later, human remains were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a wooded area, prompting officials to determine if they belong to Scott. Police have arrested 21-year-old Keon King, who is charged with her kidnapping and a prior domestic kidnapping case, based on phone tracking and digital evidence showing contact with Scott. King, who was previously charged in a domestic incident that was dropped in May, is now facing refiled charges, with a preliminary hearing expected soon. Investigators believe the case may be part of a pattern of behavior. A public tip led to the discovery of a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King, which was found in a parking lot. Authorities are searching the vehicle and investigating whether other individuals were involved. The case is being led by the Philadelphia Police Department with assistance from the FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force. The family, particularly Scott’s parents, has expressed deep anguish and has urged the public to come forward with any information. The city and officials are committed to ensuring accountability and providing support to the family.
title: Police Investigate Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman After Finding Human Remains in Shallow Grave
